newsitem.title: CHINA: BP, Shanghai Petrochem plan $2.5 bln venture.
newsitem.headline: BP, Shanghai Petrochem plan $2.5 bln venture.

text.p: A subsidiary of British Petroleum said on Monday it had signed a letter of intent with Shanghai Petrochemical Co Ltd to set up a $2.5 billion ethylene cracker in Shanghai.
BP Chemicals and Shanghai Petroleum would each hold a 50 percent stake in the venture, which would have a production capacity of 650,000 tonnes of ethylene per year, BP said.
BP's equity investment would include cash and technology, while Shanghai Petrochem's contribution would include some of its existing plants, it said.
The project would be BP's largest investment in China and also Shanghai Petrochem's largest joint venture, BP said. It did not say when construction would begin.
BP has signed 15 chemical licence agreements with Chinese partners since 1973. It has opened offices in Beijing, Shanghai Guangzhou and Fuzhou.
China Petrochemical Corp, or SINOPEC, is the majority shareholder of Shanghai Petrochem.
